answers.answer: Hi there!Well, without a detailed clinical evaluation it would be difficult to determine the cause of your symptoms. Possibilities that may need to be considered include infections affecting the neuro-muscular system, micronutrient deficiencies, vasculitis, high/ low blood pressure, respiratory system/ GI related causes, inflammation, neuropathies, myopathies, low blood sugar, heavy metal poisoning etc. I would suggest getting this evaluated by an internist initially and depending on the cause(s) diagnosed/ suspected, it can be managed accordingly or specialist(s) care may be sought.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: Hello, 24 yr old 280 lbs maleI have been experiencing the following symptoms for 6 months, many tests done, going to see Neuro Dec 18th, wanting to hear some opionionsFacial numbness (not a total numbness more like a weird gummy sensation generally to the left of my mouth and chin/jaw after I tough my face it feels my hand is still there, I also have some temple pressure and a similar feeling under my eyes in cheek )Throat TightnessEye/vision changes (when I tilt my head left/right I see a black spot)Tightness under armpit (like my shirt is too tight)Chest pressure/tightnessShin numbness/pressure (feels like somone is pulling my pant leg back against my skin, very uncomfortable)Twitching and muscle spasmsa general feeling of a vibration in my body, mostly legs.General hand shakingThese symptoms come and go, and have generally gotten less intenseI have had the following test since july all coming back normal. endoscopy, colonoscopy, Cat Scan of Brain, Chest X Rays, Multiple EKGs, Blood work ruling out diabetes, Stress Echo, MRI Brain, MRI Neck, MRI Back (minor small disc bulge in T7-T8 i was told it has zero significance), EMG, Nerve conduction. Also ruling out LYME.
title: What Can these symptoms be?
